results.title: Exxon Mobil 2025 Company Profile
results.content: ExxonMobil is an integrated oil and gas company that explores for, produces, and refines oil worldwide. In 2024, it produced 3.0 million barrels of liquids and

results.title: ExxonMobil
results.content: The company's lack of ownership over the Standard Oil name across the United States, however, prompted a name change to unify all of its brands under one name, choosing Exxon in 1972 over continuing to use the three distinct brands of Esso, Enco "Enco (brand)"), and Humble Oil. In 1998, the two companies agreed to merge and form ExxonMobil, with the deal closing on November 30, 1999. ExxonMobil is the largest non-government-owned company in the international energy industry and produces about 3% of the world's oil and about 2% of the world's energy. ExxonMobil Chemical is a petrochemical company that was created by merging Exxon's and Mobil's chemical industries in 1999. According to *Fortune* Global 500, ExxonMobil was the second largest company, second largest publicly held corporation, and the largest oil company in the United States by 2017 revenue. "Top 10 Oil & Gas Companies: ExxonMobil".
